Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that looks healthy with plenty of water.
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy or wilted without water.
The student can illustrate the difference between plants exposed to light and those kept in darkness.
The student can show that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can use patterns in their drawings to show how the presence or absence of water affects plant growth.
